title: Orange Chicken
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, trimmed and cut into 1" pieces
1 quart peanut or vegetable oil for frying
directions: FOR THE SAUCE: Using vegetable peeler, remove eight 2" strips of zest from 1 orange. Using a rasp-style grate, grate 1 1/2 tsp of zest from the remaining orange. Halve both oranges and squeeze to get 3/4 cup of juice.
Combine the orange zest (strips and grated) and juice, broth, vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, cornstarch, garlic, ginger, siracha, and oil in a medium sauce pan and whisk to dissolve the cornstarch.
Bring the sauce to a simmer over medium-high heat, stirring frequently. Cook until dark brown and thickened, about 2 minutes. Cover and set aside.
Combine the chicken, egg whites, and salt in a bowl.
Place cornstarch, flour and baking powder in a double-bagged large paper shopping bag. Roll top of bag to seal and shake gently to combine.
Add the chicken mixture to the cornstarch mixture in a bag, roll the top of the bag to seal, and shake vigorously to thoroughly coat the chicken. Set it aside.
Line a rimmed baking sheet with a triple layer of paper towels. Add oil to a large dutch oven and heat over medium-high heat to 350 degrees.
Shake the chicken in the bag once more. Add half of the chicken to the hot oil and fry until cooked through (chicken will still be somewhat pale), 4 to 6 minutes, stirring frequently.

Adjust the burner, if necessary, to maintain an oil temperature between 300 and 350 degrees. Using a slotted spoon or spider skimmer, transfer the fried chicken to the prepared sheet. Return the oil to 350 degrees and repeat with the remaining chicken.
Warm the sauce over a medium heat until simmering, about 1 minute. Toss the sauce and chicken in a large bowl until the chicken is evenly coated.
Serve, sprinkling individual portions with scallions.
